author: ajsutton
content:
So on the last call we said we'd plan to do the altair upgrade on Pyrmont in three weeks which is around about 19 August. Tradition is for testnets to use a palindrome, which would suggest epoch 61616 is a good option (slot 1971712 which is 2021-08-19 08:22:31 UTC) Conveniently not midnight for me. ðŸ™‚
Palindrome epoch numbers don't happen very often though so we may not want to keep that tradition.

If we just went for reasonably round numbers, I'd suggest epoch 61700 (slot 1974400 at 2021-08-19 20:39:55 UTC) which is the timeslot we use internally for AU-EU-US meetings because it works out as kind of ok for everyone.

author: ajsutton
content: Scratch that, looks like Google docs can't add 12 seconds reliably. ðŸ˜¦ So those times are off.

author: ajsutton
content:
Right some options with correct times:
Epoch 61500   Slot 1968000 2021-08-18 20:00:07Z - Standard ConsenSys multi-timezone meeting time, but a day earlier
Epoch 61600   Slot 1971200  2021-08-19 06:40:07Z - Good for AU & EU but awful for US
Epoch 61650   Slot 1972800  2021-08-19 12:00:07Z - Seems pretty good all round.
Epoch 61700   Slot 1974400 2021-08-19 17:20:07Z - 3am AU time, please no. ðŸ™‚

So I'd say either epopch 61500 or 61650.
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1UnsJQffNVuxbECSAgez4UaINVDDHm-svoWvhTGIuHFk/edit?usp=sharing lists epochs, slots and times in UTC, Brisbane time and New York time.
